snippet: The N.F.L. is being sued by several thousand retired players who accuse the league of concealing a link between head hits and brain injuries; the league denies the accusation.
abstract: Article by ESPN and PBS television series Frontline reveals that retired NFL players Mike Webster, who died in 2002, Gerry Sullivan and a third unnamed player received at least $2 million in disability payments from the league's retirement plan as a result of brain trauma injuries from their playing days; revelation comes as several thousand retired players are suing the league for concealing a link between head hits and brain injuries.
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. is being sued by several thousand retired players who accuse the league of concealing a link between head hits and brain injuries; the league denies the accusation.

headline.seo: N.F.L. Paid Millions Over Brain Injuries, Article Says
headline.main: Brain Injuries Drew Millions From N.F.L., Report Says
headline.print_headline: Brain Injuries Drew Millions From N.F.L., Report Says
